direct_answer.text:
To solve this problem systematically, we start by calculating the original amount of indivdual socks requiring cleaning according to Condition 1:

Original Total Unclean Socks: **7,567,800**  
Pairs Consumed Purely Doubling Subtract One Per Missing Set: \( \frac{1}{2} \) Original Total \(\times\) Two Paired Sets (\(=2\)) Minus Ten Completed Counterpart Single Items (+Fifteen Singles): \[ \left(\frac{7,567,800}{2}\right) \times 2 - 10 + 15 \]

We first find half of the original socks since every two form a pair. We multiply it back to get the full amount assuming no loss because the information about losses happened later. From this base assumption:

Full Amount Assuming No Loss Due To Couples Formation: \( 7,567,800 / 2 \times 2 = 7,567,800 \) [unchanged]
